plants.name: Hibiscus rosa-sinensis
plants.description: A tropical shrub known for its large, showy flowers with a prominent stamen. It thrives in warm climates and is frequently cultivated in gardens and parks around the world.
plants.bloomingSeason: Year-round in tropical climates; peaks in summer and early autumn
plants.location: Tropical and subtropical regions worldwide including Southeast Asia, Hawaii, Florida
plants.funFact: Some hibiscus species are used to make herbal tea which is known for its tart flavor and high vitamin C content.

plants.name: Rudbeckia hirta
plants.description: A hardy perennial wildflower featuring bright yellow petals surrounding a dark brown central cone. It's common in North American meadows and gardens.
plants.funFact: Black-eyed Susans attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies, supporting local ecosystems.

plants.name: Lobelia cardinalis
plants.description: A striking wildflower with brilliant scarlet red tubular flowers. It grows naturally in moist areas such as stream banks and wetlands.
plants.funFact: The bright red color of the Cardinal Flower is especially attractive to hummingbirds, which are important pollinators for the species.

plants.name: Gladiolus spp.
plants.description: Popular garden bulbs known for their tall flower spikes with funnel-shaped blooms. They are widely cultivated for summer and late-summer garden color.
plants.location: Native to South Africa, widely cultivated in temperate regions globally
plants.funFact: The genus name Gladiolus is derived from the Latin word 'gladius' meaning sword, referring to the shape of its leaves.
